1.speaker: Karlach
1.text: I can't believe Wyll's given up his soul to Zariel. For a father he fell out with ages ago. There's such a thing as being too good. Someone ought to tell Wyll Ravengard.
1.context: NodeContext: She's sad because Wyll gave up his soul.

10.speaker: Karlach
10.text: The Blade of Frontiers. A true return to form, isn't it. Proud of you, Wyll. As ever.

12.speaker: Karlach
12.text: So - the gith prince, huh? We've got some decisions to make.

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: Damn. Bye-bye, Shadowheart. Hate to see her go, but I'm also not sure bringing her into a Sharran temple would've been the best idea for us. Or her.

15.speaker: Karlach
15.text: Damn. Wish Lae'zel and Shadowheart could've solved that without coming to blows. I guess it's no surprise the githyanki warrior won out, but Shadowheart held her own.

286.speaker: Karlach
286.text: I'm going to miss her. She was all right.
286.context: NodeContext: all right is an understatement - Karlach was very fond of her.

16.speaker: Karlach
16.text: About what happened - about your affliction. I know you're sorry. And I know you're probably afraid it'll happen again.

549.speaker: Karlach
549.text: I'll look after myself. You look after you. If we each do our part, we'll both be all right.

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: Something in the air down here. It's like this place wants to be forgotten.

27.speaker: Karlach
27.text: It's evil in here. Let's get in and get out fast.

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: It's done, then. There's a Slayer among us.

239.speaker: Karlach
239.text: What the fuck is happening to us?

491.speaker: Karlach
491.text: I guess all we can do is hope we all stay sane long enough to save the city.

34.speaker: Karlach
34.text: I couldn't help overhearing what Elminster said to Gale. Not every day a god asks for a chat.

67.speaker: Karlach
67.text: Hey! Maybe I'm invited too. I can be the muscle.

36.speaker: Karlach
36.text: I can't believe Wyll's given up his soul to Zariel. For a father he fell out with ages ago. There's such a thing as being too good. Someone ought to tell Wyll Ravengard.
36.context: NodeContext: She's sad because Wyll gave up his soul.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: There we have it. A Chosen of Bhaal. An ally of Gortash. Right under my nose.

265.speaker: Karlach
265.text: I want to say it doesn't make sense - but it makes perfect sense, doesn't it? I should've seen it earlier. All the signs were there.

433.speaker: Karlach
433.text: I don't want to talk now. Give me time. A lot of it.

51.speaker: Karlach
51.text: The Emperor might be right, but we're not out of options yet.
51.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subject: We have an option: Me

436.speaker: Karlach
436.text: Let me transform. I'm... I'm not long for this world. I can feel it.
436.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subject: Re-establish the Karlach optionNodeContext: The weight behind this is Karlach knows she's gonna die, and that's why she's offering.

456.speaker: Karlach
456.text: There'll be no risk in the Emperor controlling me - it's the perfect solution.
456.context: NodeContext: A little sad, but resolute.

333.speaker: Karlach
333.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subject: Direct focus to player. What do you think we should do?NodeContext: Growing resolve.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: This should be my sacrifice to make. Not yours.

427.speaker: Karlach
427.text: Soldier, my heart feels like a live grenade - gonna blow any minute. You still have a life to live. I don't.

128.speaker: Karlach
128.text: Let me do this for you. For me. Please, darling. I want to.
128.context: NodeContext: Her resolve cracks slightly on the 'darling,' an aside to the player if they're in love.

14.speaker: Karlach
14.text: If this is the end for me, let me be the motherfucker who saved the world.
14.context: NodeContext: A return to her swag.

312.speaker: Player
312.text: All right. If this is what you really want, all I can say is thank you.

226.speaker: Karlach
226.context: NodeContext: Full of Bond-like charm. She's just agreed to take on the ultimate sacrifice, and she's doing it with style.

543.speaker: Karlach
543.text: If anyone was gonna be able to pull off a few tentacles, it was going to be me. Let's do this.

479.speaker: Player
479.text: I can't, Karlach. I'm sorry. I want it to be me, not you.

457.speaker: Karlach
457.text: I know you. I know you know your own mind. If this is what you want, then all I can say is give 'em Hell, soldier.

178.speaker: Karlach
178.text: I won't have to look at you much longer anyway, so I'm really getting the good end of the deal.
178.context: NodeContext: Cheekily. Saying she's dying soon so she won't have to see the player be an ugly mind flayer for long. Macabre humor, but she means it affectionately.

329.speaker: Player
329.text: No - none of us is turning into a mind flayer. If that means giving them the stones, then so be it.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: We should at least free Orpheus first. There might be another solution here.

236.speaker: Karlach
236.text: I trust you. Do what you think is right, and I'll stand by you.

467.speaker: Karlach
467.text: But if you change your mind, just say so. I'm here. And I'm ready for whatever comes next.

439.speaker: Player
439.text: If this is the end for you, you should go out as yourself, not a mind flayer.

520.speaker: Karlach
520.text: I'd rather be a mind flayer than have to watch you become one. You still get to live. Do it as you.

606.speaker: Player
606.text: Are you sure this is what you want?

119.speaker: Karlach
119.text: I've never been more sure of anything. This heart inside me is about to blow. Doesn't matter which body it takes out with it, right?

438.speaker: Karlach
438.context: NodeContext: Her resolve cracks slightly on the 'darling,' an aside to the player if they're in love.

55.speaker: Karlach
55.text: Wow. 'Chosen of Mystra.' I guess I should congratulate Gale. Right?
55.context: NodeContext: Karlach is happy for Gale. Suspicious of Mystra but trying to be supportive.

8.speaker: Karlach
8.text: I trust him to know what he's doing. To know how far to go for Mystra. I just hope he knows he doesn't need her favour to be fucking fantastic.

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: Whoa. I've seen a lot, but never been threatened by a god.

235.speaker: Karlach
235.text: It sounded like Gale really meant it. He really wants to take control of the Karsite Weave.

583.speaker: Karlach
583.text: He really wants to be a god.
583.context: NodeContext: She's not bought in. She's assessing GAle here. Measuring him.

58.speaker: Karlach
58.text: Can you believe this is my first time in the Underdark? The world is so big.

63.speaker: Karlach
63.text: Alfira's dead. And whoever did kill her will pay for it. Got it?
63.context: NodeContext: Suspicious of the player but not outright accusing

68.speaker: Karlach
68.text: That bloody freak won't get away with this. That's my wizard she took. And we're going to get him back.

70.speaker: Karlach
70.text: That bloody shapeshifting freak! No one takes my githyanki and gets away with it.

77.speaker: Karlach
77.text: You've really done it now, Shadowheart. I hope you know what the fuck you're getting yourself into.

111.speaker: Karlach
111.text: Killing a restrained enemy - one who never did shit to you? That's just low. Even for a Sharran.

78.speaker: Karlach
78.text: Minthara's pregnant. A new life, a little one, sprung from all this fuckin' chaos.

357.speaker: Karlach
357.text: All the more reason to put this place to rights. Give Little Minthy every chance of a normal life. And hey - if you're in the market for godmothers, I have availability from now 'til the rest of my life.

85.speaker: Karlach
85.text: Just me or is... is it hot in here?
85.context: NodeContext: Karlach starting to overheat. But we don't want to belabor this too much since she still has some normal dialogue coming

87.speaker: Karlach
87.text: You did the right thing, Wyll. Your father will die with honour. He will go with the gods. If you sacrificed yourself, you'd be lost forever.

353.speaker: Karlach
353.text: He would want this. I'm certain of it. Though I'm also certain I'd like to wring Mizora's neck for what she's put you through.

266.speaker: Player
266.text: I can't believe what I've done. My own father...

88.speaker: Karlach
88.text: Your father is a legend. An honourable man who gave his life for his city. We all owe him gratitude - but you don't owe him your soul.

215.speaker: Player
215.text: I should never have become entangled with Mizora. This is all my fault.

454.speaker: Karlach
454.text: You had no other choice. That's life, sometimes. Unfair as fuck. But you didn't do this - she did. You only played the hand you were dealt.

412.speaker: Player
412.text: I hope my father would agree.

192.speaker: Karlach
192.text: Duke Ulder Ravengard would want what was best for his son. I know you two had your differences, but he loved you. He wouldn't change a thing.

90.speaker: Karlach
90.text: The Emperor might be right, but we're not out of options yet.
90.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subject: We have an option: Me

91.speaker: Karlach
91.text: Minsc just joined our team. This is the best day of my life.
91.context: NodeContext: Minsc and Jaheira are heroes. Karlach is in absolute disbelief that these two legends joined the team.

95.speaker: Karlach
95.text: It's over, darling. You're free. Now you can start processing everything that's happened - believe me, it's plenty.

97.speaker: Karlach
97.text: Swit swoo, woman! Never thought I'd be so delighted at the sight of a forehead. You look amazing!
97.context: NodeContext: Shadowheart changed her hairdo. Karlach is gassing her up, very enthusasitc.

98.speaker: Karlach
98.text: Gods! So much for our cure. That thing almost popped you like a watermelon.

102.speaker: Karlach
102.context: NodeContext: Excited crying/ fangirling about seeing her hero in action.

110.speaker: Karlach
110.text: Damn. It can't have been easy for Lae'zel to stand up to Vlaakith like that. But there's nothing that woman can't do.

112.speaker: Karlach
112.text: We've worn Ketheric down, but the cadaver still has some life in him. Down the tentacle hole we go.
112.context: NodeContext: Party defeated Ketheric in combat on the rooftop of Moonrise, during the assault. He has now retreated to the Colony, and the party saw a giant tentacle burst through the roof of the Tower. High intensity situation.

116.speaker: Karlach
116.text: You know, for a while there, I thought Shadowheart was going to stay stuck in Sharville. Maybe become the duke of the place.

384.speaker: Karlach
384.text: But she's done what so few are able for. She's created her own path. And now she's got her folks back, too. I love to see it.

117.speaker: Karlach
117.text: That bloody freak won't get away with this. We're going to hunt her down and take Yenna back. Mark my words.

120.speaker: Karlach
120.text: We have a lot to think about. Let's do it far away from this place.

121.speaker: Karlach
121.text: Very glad mysteria and the githyanki settled things without letting any blood. While I would've enjoyed the spectacle, I wouldn't have liked to lose either one just yet.
121.context: NodeContext: mysteria = a cheeky nickname for Shadowheart

124.speaker: Karlach
124.text: Feels like we're walking into a trap. Hope you know what you're doing, Lae.

139.speaker: Karlach
139.text: Are you all right? Of course you're not all right.
139.context: NodeContext: Karlach worried about SH and is a little awkward and fussy about tryign to help her, but very sweet too

48.speaker: Karlach
48.text: Look, I've got you. If you need a rest, lean on me. If you need a hand, take mine. If you need an ear, I've got two. Whatever you need.

140.speaker: Karlach
140.text: Damn, Shadowheart. I admit I'm impressed you beat a githyanki warrior, but I wish it didn't come to this.

142.speaker: Karlach
142.text: Well, Astarion. I stood by you and defeated the last obstacle to your reign as the vampire lord of Baldur's Gate.

196.speaker: Karlach
196.text: Something tells me I might regret this. I'm counting on you to prove me wrong.

144.speaker: Karlach
144.text: It's done. It had to be done. Astarion was... out of control. Gods dammit.

43.speaker: Karlach
43.text: Look, he was an evil leech, but he was ours. I thought he'd changed. I was wrong. I always am these days.

148.speaker: Karlach
148.text: What is this place? And what the fuck has Gortash been doing here?

157.speaker: Karlach
157.text: Just when I think I can't respect Jaheira any more, she hits me with a grenade right to the heart.

205.speaker: Karlach
205.text: I couldn't agree with her more. There's more to life than... than time. It isn't about how long you're here. It's about what you do with whatever time you've got.

172.speaker: Karlach
172.text: And Jaheira? Well, I don't think anyone's spent their hours better than her.

160.speaker: Karlach
160.text: Whoa. I've seen a lot, but never been threatened by a god.

306.speaker: Karlach
306.text: It sounded like Gale really meant it. He really wants to take control of the Karsite Weave.

559.speaker: Karlach
559.text: He really wants to be a god.

163.speaker: Karlach
163.text: So we're knocking around with a vampire lord, now. We sure this is a good idea?

319.speaker: Player
319.text: You dare question my lord Astarion?

166.speaker: Karlach
166.text: Gods, he turned you into a spawn. I knew you were close, but... not like this.
166.context: NodeContext: Surprised, disgusted, and sad cause the player is her friend.

550.speaker: Karlach
550.text: I hope you know what you've gotten yourself into. I hope he treats you well. If he's even able to.

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: As for us... well, we can stick together until the city is well and truly saved. After that... we'll see.

283.speaker: Player
283.text: This isn't just any vampire lord. It's Astarion - our friend.

194.speaker: Karlach
194.text: I hope he still sees it that way. Something tells me he's not the same person we knew. Not anymore.

181.speaker: Karlach
181.text: No. I mean - maybe. I don't know. I'm not sure what he's capable of now that he's so... changed.

465.speaker: Karlach
465.text: Time will tell. But I'm keeping an eye out.

522.speaker: Player
522.text: No - I'm not sure we can trust what he's become.

345.speaker: Karlach
345.text: Me either. Luckily, vampires - even vampire lords - aren't as hard to kill as they may seem.

219.speaker: Karlach
219.text: I hope it won't come to that. But if it does, I'm ready.

169.speaker: Karlach
169.text: I hope Zevlor rests in the softest, sweetest peace possible. He deserved more than he got.

174.speaker: Karlach
174.text: The Blade of Avernus. I can't think of a better man than Wyll to take up the title. It's about time someone stood up to the evil fucks populating the Hells.

184.speaker: Karlach
184.text: I couldn't help overhearing. So Mystra wants to talk, does she? Not every day a god asks for a chat.

187.speaker: Karlach
187.text: I bet Lae'zel is absolutely lethal with that sword.

4.speaker: Karlach
4.text: She can teach me how to slice, and I'll teach her how to bash.

189.speaker: Karlach
189.text: Very glad Shadowheart and Lae'zel settled things without letting any blood. I would've enjoyed the spectacle, but not losing either one of those lunatics.

197.speaker: Karlach
197.text: He'd hate to hear me say this, but I'm so fucking proud of Astarion. He could've had it all, but he kept his soul instead.

46.speaker: Karlach
46.text: Wasn't sure he had it in him, but he's changed so much. Overcome so much darkness. Ooh, I could smooch that pointy little face!

198.speaker: Karlach
198.text: I can feel it. So much infernal machinery - and magic - at work here.

463.speaker: Karlach
463.text: Gortash must've done some dark shit to get his hands on all these creepy contraptions.

199.speaker: Karlach
199.text: I can't believe it. We killed him. Minsc. The beloved ranger.
199.context: NodeContext: Karlach is sad/ disbelieving cause she really wanted to meet Minsc but the party had no choice but to kill him.

297.speaker: Karlach
297.text: His mind was all addled - like a bog standard True Soul. But... he could've been brought round. Couldn't he?

248.speaker: Player
248.text: It was too risky to wait and see. He was coming at us with all he had.

416.speaker: Karlach
416.text: We should've been more careful. Knocked him out, you know? The Astral Prism might've brought him round, same as it did for us.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Maybe. But we'll never know now.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: He attacked us. We attacked back. Simple as.

175.speaker: Karlach
175.text: But... argh! I wish we could've held back a little. Knocked him out, seen if the Astral Prism would've brought him round.

530.speaker: Karlach
530.text: Minsc was a hero. He deserved a hero's death. Not this. We'll avenge him. The Dead Three did this, really. And we're going to stop their fucked up plan in its tracks.

201.speaker: Karlach
201.text: Not in the habit of arguing with gods, but I'm not sure what to do. Whatever might be 'corrupted' about the Prism, it's helped us thus far.

150.speaker: Karlach
150.text: Not sure I trust the gith queen not to crush us once we've done what she asks.

202.speaker: Karlach
202.text: And I thought I knew what hell was...

203.speaker: Karlach
203.text: Gods, when this is over, I'm taking the hottest bath known to man or devil.

213.speaker: Karlach
213.text: Wow, Gale. 'Chosen of Mystra.' Congratulations, I think?
213.context: NodeContext: Karlach is happy for Gale. Suspicious of Mystra but trying to be supportive.

593.speaker: Karlach
593.text: I trust you to know what you're doing. To know how far to go for Mystra. Just know that even without her - even without any of the gods - you're still pretty fantastic.

82.speaker: Karlach
82.text: 'Chosen of Karlach' has a ring to it, right?

216.speaker: Karlach
216.text: I'll admit it, I was saying my prayers there. Thank the gods we made it out of Gortash's hellhole.

218.speaker: Karlach
218.text: This fella Gale has as many lives as a cat. Handy guy to have around, huh?

221.speaker: Karlach
221.text: Thought this place was going to blow. We'll live to fight another day.
221.context: NodeContext: Not too urgent but not hanging around.

224.speaker: Karlach
224.text: Astarion would hate this, but I'm so fucking proud of him.

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: He could've had it all - but it would've cost his soul. He kept what was worth keeping. That can't have been easy.

229.speaker: Karlach
229.text: Fucking hell! Those goons came into our territory, our camp, and took our friend.
229.context: NodeContext: Blaming herself for Astarion being taken. Furious.

380.speaker: Karlach
380.text: And I just... I just let it happen! I couldn't stop them! What the fuck am I good for if not that?! ARGH!
380.context: NodeContext: Blaming herself for Astarion being taken. Furious.

230.speaker: Karlach
230.text: I'm so glad Shadowheart's ordeal is over. It'll be a long time before she'll come to terms with all this. But at least, now, she can start. Free of Shar.

234.speaker: Karlach
234.text: Careful, soldier. I'm used to heat like this, but too much smoke could knock you dead.

240.speaker: Karlach
240.text: Come on. We need to get up and out.

244.speaker: Karlach
244.text: Finally get to live out my rogue-ish fantasies down here.

255.speaker: Karlach
255.text: Wow, Gale. So you spoke to Mystra, right?

170.speaker: Karlach
170.text: Pretty spectacular stuff. But I think you were right not to do her bidding, no questions asked.

369.speaker: Karlach
369.text: I respect the gods, but they don't always understand what they're asking of us. Maybe immortality makes it hard to know what it's like to be one of us piggies.

242.speaker: Karlach
242.text: Proud of you, though. It takes some man to hold his own in front of the divine.

256.speaker: Karlach
256.text: Ketheric's waiting for us. Can only imagine the beating that angel is preparing for him.

92.speaker: Karlach
92.text: Thanks to your good sense, we have a chance at beating him. I know it wasn't easy, going your own way - it never is. You're some woman, Shadowheart.
92.context: NodeContext: Karlach to SH with warmth.

258.speaker: Karlach
258.text: Is Gale all right? He's looking a little shadowy about the gills.

260.speaker: Karlach
260.text: Shadowheart may not be able to remember what she's done. But I'll never forget.
260.context: NodeContext: Deep disappointment, almost to the point of heartbreak, that SH went the evil route.

268.speaker: Karlach
268.text: Gale looks chuffed as cheese. Mystra must be very pleased with him. Let's hope she's got his best interests in mind.

269.speaker: Karlach
269.text: Isobel. And all those people. What a horrible fucking day.

274.speaker: Karlach
274.text: Shadowheart versus Lae'zel. I can't believe ol' mysteria defeated a githyanki warrior.
274.context: NodeContext: Tonally somewhat grave: Lae'zel is dead.

536.speaker: Karlach
536.text: I've underestimated you. Won't make that mistake again.

153.speaker: Karlach
153.text: I'll miss Lae'zel. But I guess it was never going to work with that artefact on the line. May she rest in... well, something more exciting than peace. She deserves that much.

280.speaker: Karlach
280.text: You be careful with that amulet. I don't like it. At all.

281.speaker: Karlach
281.text: Wish we could stay and see what this place will be like without the shadows. I bet it's beautiful. No rest for the wicked, huh?

288.speaker: Karlach
288.text: Wide berth, buddy. I have some good equipment I don't want you swallowing.

50.speaker: Karlach
50.text: The people you meet, I swear...

80.speaker: Karlach
80.text: Much as I commiserate with your, you know, thingie.

289.speaker: Karlach
289.text: Phew. Thought Lae'zel and the walking fringe were gonna come to blows. Would've been entertaining, but I'm not ready to say goodbye to either one just yet.

293.speaker: Karlach
293.text: Our girl is nothing if not loyal. I just hope it doesn't come back to bite her in the arse. Being loyal to the wrong person can do that sometimes.

296.speaker: Karlach
296.text: Now that's what I call a spide.
296.context: NodeContext: 'spide' rather than 'spider' cause she's a goof. She's impressed by this monster they're following. Kind of said in a semi-whisper cause they are following a freaky spider man through the shadow cursed lands

298.speaker: Karlach
298.text: Hells take that Bhaal-freak. She would've bled the whole world just for the fun of it.

368.speaker: Karlach
368.text: We've got her Netherstone now. One step closer to getting the Netherbrain under control.

303.speaker: Karlach
303.context: NodeContext: Like chanting someone's name in encouragement.

304.speaker: Karlach
304.text: We need to get that Nere guy unstuck, or those gnomes are done for. Come on, focus.

310.speaker: Karlach
310.text: No one more loyal than our Lae'zel. If Voss had known that, he never would have come here throwing salt on Vlaakith's name.

313.speaker: Karlach
313.text: I don't get it. What's got Dame Aylin so down?
313.context: NodeContext: Dame Aylin isn't that happy after killing Lorroakan, the villain who was pursuing her. Karlach hasn't killed Gortash yet and doesn't get why she'd be anything other than jubilant.

109.speaker: Karlach
109.text: I for one am delighted Lorroakan got what was coming to him.
109.context: NodeContext: Dame Aylin isn't that happy after killing Lorroakan, the villain who was pursuing her. Karlach hasn't killed Gortash yet and doesn't get why she'd be anything other than jubilant.

590.speaker: Player
590.text: As am I. But Dame Aylin has endured a great deal; she must be tired of killing evil-doers.

564.speaker: Karlach
564.text: I don't know. Isn't that what a paladin of Selûne does?
564.context: NodeContext: responding to 'maybe Aylin is tired and that's why she's not that hype about killing her enemy'.

210.speaker: Karlach
210.text: Hope that good old Aylin holy fervour returns to her soon. I don't like to see her looking so... lost.
210.context: NodeContext: Foreshadowing her own reaction to killing Gortash

451.speaker: Player
451.text: Perhaps revenge isn't as sweet as it seems.

489.speaker: Karlach
489.text: Pff. Believe me, I plan to revel mightily once I've finished with Gortash.
489.context: NodeContext: responding to 'maybe revenge isn't as sweet as it seems'.

385.speaker: Karlach
385.text: Hopefully Dame Aylin will be back to herself by then, so she can congratulate me on a murtherer well-broken.
385.context: NodeContext: 'murtherer well-broken' is echoing Aylin's own archaic speech style, and echoing the speech she (Aylin) just gave while killing Lorroakan.

301.speaker: Player
301.text: She went too far. There's something dark in her - and it's growing.

64.speaker: Karlach
64.text: Don't mistake justice for something worse. Aylin has every right to be angry - furious even.

386.speaker: Karlach
386.text: I'm glad to see her letting it out - she deserves that much. She'll cheer up. Probably just tired, like she said.
386.context: NodeContext: KArlach is being a little naive here, projecting her own desire for revenge onto Aylin and refusign to see that something dark is happening inside Aylin, because Karlach wants to feel good about killing Gortash.

320.speaker: Karlach
320.text: The Absolute wants the Prism. The githyanki want the Prism. Shar wants the Prism too. Phew, this thing means an awful lot to a lot of people.

493.speaker: Karlach
493.text: Us more than anyone. Without that thing, we'd have been drooling True Souls.

191.speaker: Karlach
191.text: Surprised to find I share an aim with Shar herself, but the Absolute has to be stopped. Let Shar have the lost - better that than the Netherbrain.

322.speaker: Karlach
322.text: Let me do this, soldier. I can save us. What better way to go out?

324.speaker: Karlach
324.text: Ah, Wyll. There is such a thing as being too good, you know.

349.speaker: Karlach
349.text: I don't want Zariel to have you. I can't stand it. But... it's done, isn't it?

42.speaker: Player
42.text: It is, I'm afraid. I stand by my choice.

69.speaker: Karlach
69.text: May we all live up to the standard you set, Wyll. Somehow.
69.context: NodeContext: With utmost affection and admiration.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: For now. Life is long; anything could happen.

356.speaker: Karlach
356.text: If the gods are gods, they won't let Wyll Ravengard's soul stay forever in the hands of Zariel. You're too precious for that.
356.context: NodeContext: With utmost affection and admiration.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: Let us think of other things. We still have plenty to do before giving up the ghost.

568.speaker: Karlach
568.text: Saving the city we love, for one. And for me, trying to live up to the standard you set.
568.context: NodeContext: With utmost affection and admiration.

334.speaker: Karlach
334.text: I hope being a rampaging bloodsucker is everything Astarion dreamed it would be.

335.speaker: Karlach
335.text: Damn, Lae'zel. It can't have been easy to stand up to Vlaakith like that. But there's nothing Lae'zel of Crèche K'liir of can't do.

339.speaker: Karlach
339.text: Well done getting that creep off Dame Aylin's tail. The last thing she needs is more trouble dogging her heels.

579.speaker: Karlach
579.text: Then again, she may want to know exactly who's been offering a small fortune for her capture. She may have some thoughts about that.

340.speaker: Karlach
340.text: Tsk. I hate seeing Shadowheart suffer like this. All for doing the right thing.

326.speaker: Karlach
326.text: It's up to us to look after her now. If she needs a rest, we carry her. If she needs a hand, she has ours. If she needs ears, we've got four between us. Whatever she needs.

341.speaker: Karlach
341.text: Can't believe that devil just took us into the Hells with a snap of his fingers. If I see him again, I'll wring his neck.

273.speaker: Player
273.text: He seemed to have a solution for our tadpoles. We may not want to reject his help outright.

302.speaker: Karlach
302.text: Better to die than live in a cambion's debt. Believe me. No offence, Wyll.
302.context: NodeContext: Suddenly realizing Wyll is standing right there in debt to a devil. And she loves Wyll, so oops

370.speaker: Wyll
370.context: NodeContext: With a shrug. A bit of a comedy moment.

20.speaker: Karlach
20.text: Look, this - Raphael, was it? He's trying to lure us into a game he knows we can't win. Don't let him.

279.speaker: Karlach
279.text: We'll figure out the tadpole. I'm here now, and I'm very lucky.

477.speaker: Karlach
477.text: Better to die than live in a cambion's debt. Believe me.

125.speaker: Karlach
125.text: Raphael - that's his name, right? He's trying to lure us into a game he knows we can't win. Don't let him.

348.speaker: Karlach
348.context: NodeContext: Player affirmed they'd let her kick Raphael's ass if given the chance.

282.speaker: Player
282.text: Was that the Hells? How could you tell?

253.speaker: Karlach
253.text: My engine stopped fuming, for one. But even without that, I could just feel it.

555.speaker: Karlach
555.text: Raphael was his name, right? He's trying to lure us into a game he knows we can't win.

284.speaker: Karlach
284.text: I'm not playing. Glad you're not either.

485.speaker: Karlach
485.text: I could just feel it. Evil, radiating out of every bloody apple.

346.speaker: Karlach
346.text: Gale's walking a thin line. Let's hope he doesn't fall headfirst over it - again.

350.speaker: Karlach
350.text: Wow. Gale is the 'Chosen of Mystra'. Congrats to him, I think?

18.speaker: Karlach
18.text: Hope he knows what he's doing. We haven't fared very well with other Chosens so far.

354.speaker: Karlach
354.text: Thought this place was just a legend. Tall tales just keep coming true.

358.speaker: Karlach
358.text: Very glad you and Lae'zel settled things without letting any blood. While I would've enjoyed the spectacle, my money's on the githyanki. And I'd hate to lose you, fringe.

359.speaker: Karlach
359.text: Another dead end. If the tadpole doesn't kill us, trying to cure it just might.

360.speaker: Karlach
360.text: It's done, then. There's a Slayer among us.

331.speaker: Karlach
331.text: Look, I don't care what you look like - what form you can take. I care who you are. And you're... you're not who I thought you'd be. Who I'd hoped you'd be.

515.speaker: Karlach
515.text: We're allies - for now - and we have a mission far greater than your... predilections. Stay sane long enough for us to save the city. Then we'll see where we stand.

291.speaker: Player
291.text: That was Elminster Aumar - the most famous wizard in the realms.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Yes it was. Good old Grandfather Dekarios, come to check in on his doting grandson.

562.speaker: Karlach
562.text: Lovely! You should've introduced him around. Elders love me, and I love them.

231.speaker: Player
231.text: I'm joking, Karlach. That was Elminster Aumar, the Sage of Shadowdale, one of the greatest wizards to ever live?

598.speaker: Karlach
598.text: Huh. Doesn't ring a bell. But all right! Must've had something important to say, if he came all this way. Good news, I hope.

541.speaker: Player
541.text: It relates to a 'condition' I have. I carry an orb of corrupted Weave within my chest. It seems Mystra wants me to detonate that orb and destroy the 'Heart of the Absolute.'

423.speaker: Player
423.text: He brought instructions from Mystra. I'm to find the Heart of the Absolute, and destroy it by detonating the orb in my chest.

93.speaker: Karlach
93.text: The orb in your chest? Shit - I knew something was going on with you, but I didn't know the particulars.

500.speaker: Karlach
500.text: Well. Turns out we have more in common than I knew. Except I'm trying not to blow up, and you've been instructed to do just that.

222.speaker: Karlach
222.text: Wow. That's... that's big, Gale. This is Mystra we're talking about. Goddess of magic - and she's asking you to sacrifice yourself.

113.speaker: Karlach
113.context: NodeContext: As in, 'What are your thoughts about this serious revelation?'

586.speaker: Player
586.text: This could be my chance at redemption. I have to at least consider dong what she asked.

89.speaker: Karlach
89.text: Only you can decide if that's really true. If you owe her your life. As for me, I'm positive we can stop the Absolute without losing you, Gale.

254.speaker: Karlach
254.text: Keep that in mind, all right?

252.speaker: Player
252.text: I'm not quite sure yet. It's a big decision.

437.speaker: Karlach
437.text: No kidding. What could be bigger? Look, I know what it's like to house something dangerous inside you. But I don't know what it's like for someone else - someone I trust - to ask me to use it against myself.

217.speaker: Karlach
217.text: If you need a friend, you know where to find me. Right here. Right now.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Now that I'm over the shock, I'll probably ignore her request entirely.

554.speaker: Karlach
554.text: I'm glad to hear you say that. It is shocking. Imagine asking someone to - to end themselves like that.

53.speaker: Karlach
53.text: Nothing's ever simple anymore, is it? Whatever you decide, I've got your back. But I think we can defeat the Absolute without losing you, Gale.

200.speaker: Player
200.text: I'd rather not talk about it right now. It's a lot to process.

105.speaker: Karlach
105.text: All right, soldier. But look, if  you're in a fix that can be solved by fire or fists, just point me in the right direction. I mean it.

330.speaker: Player
330.text: Elminster's no ordinary elder. He's the most renowned wizard in the realms.

295.speaker: Karlach
295.text: Your grandfather is the most famous wizard in the realms?

208.speaker: Karlach
208.text: I should've guessed. I mean, you're pretty powerful. Makes sense that it's in your blood.

278.speaker: Player
278.text: No, Karlach - I was joking before. Elminster isn't my grandfather. But he did tell me something quite serious.

167.speaker: Karlach
167.text: I'm listening. What did he say?

351.speaker: Player
351.text: That was none of your business. Let's move on, shall we?

362.speaker: Karlach
362.text: So we're going to meet Voss in the city, are we? Set the tenant of the Prism free? This is all very... I don't know. I like a good caper, but I'd long for a tiny bit of status quo now and again.

363.speaker: Karlach
363.text: Do you feel that? I've never felt so cold. And that's me. This place will swallow us whole if we let it. Stick close to Mama K.
363.context: NodeContext: Not too urgent but not hanging around.

373.speaker: Karlach
373.text: There we have it. You were working with Gortash. You were a chosen of Bhaal. I guess you still are.

388.speaker: Karlach
388.text: I want to say it doesn't make sense - but it makes perfect sense, doesn't it? I should've seen it earlier. All the signs were there.

601.speaker: Karlach
601.text: I don't want to talk now. Give me time. A lot of it.

377.speaker: Karlach
377.text: Everything is so slimy. At this rate, Ketheric plans to squeeze out of our grasp like a greased pig.
377.context: NodeContext: High tension, just landed in a mind flayer colony. She's disgusted by the environment.

448.speaker: Karlach
448.text: I'll hog-tie him and force him to get this tadpole out if it's the last thing he does.
448.context: NodeContext: High tension, just landed in a mind flayer colony. She's disgusted by the environment.

378.speaker: Karlach
378.text: I've got my eye on that rogue. For a few reasons.

185.speaker: Karlach
185.text: He's not infernal, at least. But there's something else about him. Let's hope whatever's going on under that impressive mop is good news.

379.speaker: Karlach
379.text: Wow. So Gale really talked to Mystra, huh?

247.speaker: Karlach
247.text: Pretty spectacular stuff. But he's right not to do her bidding, no questions asked.

270.speaker: Karlach
270.text: I respect the gods, but they don't always understand what they're asking of us. Maybe immortality makes it hard to know what it's like to be one of us piggies.

392.speaker: Karlach
392.text: Wish I could say I was surprised about Cazador's pact. Where blood, death, and betrayal parade, you can bet your arse a devil is riding grand marshal.

393.speaker: Karlach
393.text: Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard. Has a ring to it, doesn't it? I can't think of a better caretaker for the Gate.

397.speaker: Karlach
397.text: Poor Shadowheart. She's been jerked around so much. I want to believe the gods keep this world balanced, but sometimes... sometimes I wonder.

400.speaker: Karlach
400.text: You're glowing. Finally, you have answers. Finally, you're free. Shar may still have access to you, but you're your own woman.

558.speaker: Karlach
558.text: Your folks are absolutely precious, by the way. They must be so happy to have you back.

401.speaker: Karlach
401.text: I had a wild dream last night. This beautiful entity came to me; promised to protect me. Told me the parasite in our heads could give us power.

464.speaker: Player
464.text: I had a similar dream. A side effect of the tadpole?

585.speaker: Karlach
585.text: Sounds like it. What did you make of it?

376.speaker: Player
376.text: I think it's some kind of psionic trick. I didn't believe a word it said.

294.speaker: Karlach
294.text: Damn right. Thing's like a splinter - we just need to find a way to squeeze it out.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: It was just a dream. Nothing more.

146.speaker: Karlach
146.text: Yeah. Right. I hope so, anyway.
146.context: NodeContext: She's more doubtful than the player.

413.speaker: Player
413.text: If there's some kind of power to be unlocked from our affliction, I'm willing to try it.

195.speaker: Karlach
195.text: Seems risky if you ask me. Couldn't help getting stuck with the tadpole, but taking favours from it? Spooky.

403.speaker: Player
403.text: Sounds like a pretty intense dream.

114.speaker: Karlach
114.text: It was! And it seemed so... not real, but... not a dream, either.

483.speaker: Karlach
483.text: Anyway, I told the entity to make tracks. I don't need anything else from this tadpole, thanks very much.

406.speaker: Karlach
406.text: Phew. Thought you and the walking fringe were gonna come to blows. You would've wiped the floor with her, but I'm glad you decided not to. I like having both of you around.

407.speaker: Karlach
407.text: Damn, Lae'zel. Wish you could've solved that without... this. Wasn't there another way?

271.speaker: Karlach
271.text: I'm going to miss Shadowheart. She was all right.

410.speaker: Karlach
410.text: I was really worried for a moment there. Thought we'd lost one of our own to forces beyond imagining. I'm so glad I was wrong.
410.context: NodeContext: Warmth and delight for the player, with gravitas cause it was a tough old road

414.speaker: Karlach
414.text: Hey now, what happened to that fancy bit of gear?

503.speaker: Player
503.text: It's a long story involving the Weave, an ancient tome, and a failed attempt to please Mystra, goddess of magic.

509.speaker: Karlach
509.text: Hm. And now you have to consume gear Karlach really wants because...

481.speaker: Player
481.text: Because I have an orb of corrupted Weave within my chest. If I don't keep feeding it with magic, I'll explode with enough force to destroy a city.

285.speaker: Karlach
285.text: Well, shit. And I thought I had it bad.

38.speaker: Karlach
38.text: That's a tough hand, Gale. But I'm glad you told me. A chest-bomb shared is a chest-bomb halved, or whatever.

211.speaker: Karlach
211.text: If I spot anything that'll help, I'll hand it right over, pal. We're in this together.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Because if I didn't, I'd be dangerous to all of us.

39.speaker: Karlach
39.text: Are we talking some kind of were-wizard situation here, or...?

398.speaker: Player
398.text: I have an orb of corrupted Weave within my chest. If I don't keep feeding it with magic, I'll explode with enough force to destroy a city.

473.speaker: Player
473.text: I'll leave that up to your imagination.

83.speaker: Karlach
83.text: Wizards and their secrets. Buddy, I could ruin that mind of yours with the stories I could tell. Nothing you say could scare me. When you're ready to talk, I'm ready to listen.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I had to consume it. Sorry if that scuppered any plans you had for it.

459.speaker: Karlach
459.text: I'd mind less if I knew the full story. Never seen a fellow suck the magic-marrow out of an item before.

261.speaker: Player
261.text: I have an orb of corrupted Weave within my chest. If I don't keep feeding it with magic, I'll explode with enough force to destroy a city.

382.speaker: Player
382.text: My affliction is a unique one, as is its treatment. I consume items to ensure we remain safe from it.

453.speaker: Player
453.text: Your curiosity is justified, but will go unsated. For the time being, at least.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: I can't tell you. You'd never speak to me again.

418.speaker: Karlach
418.text: Looks like we're done here. Pity. This place has been a wild ride.
418.context: NodeContext: Not too urgent but not hanging around.

419.speaker: Karlach
419.text: Careful, soldier. Never forget Raphael has one thing in mind: Himself. Always.

420.speaker: Karlach
420.text: Mizora. I'd take anything she says with a grain of salt. But with her claws as deep in our business as they are, I guess we can't ignore her completely.

422.speaker: Karlach
422.text: Shadowheart's a funny frog. I like her fringe though. Very blunt.

424.speaker: Karlach
424.text: What is it about this place? I know we shouldn't let down our guard, but I feel... like I could drift off and never wake up.
424.context: NodeContext: Emphasizing the vampiric nature of this place.

426.speaker: Karlach
426.text: The Blade of Avernus. Has a ring to it, doesn't it? Give those devils everything you've got, Wyll. You'll have 'em shaking in their boots.

428.speaker: Karlach
428.text: Look at you, soldier! Are my eyes lying, or is there a bit of colour in those cheeks?
428.context: NodeContext: Avatar Astarion bit one of the companions during the night without disturbing them, gaining the 'Happy' status. The next day the companions can comment on how happy and refreshed he looks.

238.speaker: Karlach
238.text: Whatever you're doing, keep it up.
238.context: NodeContext: Avatar Astarion bit one of the companions during the night without disturbing them, gaining the 'Happy' status. The next day the companions can comment on how happy and refreshed he looks.

430.speaker: Karlach
430.text: Ugh, that guy makes my skin crawl. So - what's the plan? Do we chase him out of town, or skip straight to skull-cracking?
430.context: NodeContext: Subtext is she's thinking about Gortash (even though she's talking about Lorroakan).

308.speaker: Player
308.text: Dame Aylin should deal with him. It's her he's after.

309.speaker: Karlach
309.text: All right,  all right, fair enough. But ooh, can I watch?
309.context: NodeContext: giddy at the thought of watching Aylin kick Lorroakan's ass. (she hasn't killed Gortash yet and has a bit of blood lust)

147.speaker: Karlach
147.text: I'm not bloodthirsty. I'm dangerous creep-thirsty. This guy is terrible news. I say we stop him before he hurts anyone.
147.context: NodeContext: Subtext is she's thinking about Gortash (even though she's talking about Lorroakan).

123.speaker: Karlach
123.text: Better yet: Let Dame Aylin do it. She deserves to look him in the eye before she ends him.
123.context: NodeContext: Subtext is she's thinking about Gortash (even though she's talking about Lorroakan). This is before she kills Gortash, so she's bloodthirsty. Her responses change if this scene happens after she's killed Gortash

567.speaker: Player
567.text: We'll play it easy, for now. No sense spoiling for a fight we can avoid.

159.speaker: Karlach
159.text: Says you. Me, I'd love nothing more than to throat slam that creep.
159.context: NodeContext: Subtext is she's thinking about Gortash (even though she's talking about Lorroakan).

432.speaker: Karlach
432.text: Halsin is one hench elf. I'm impressed - and glad he's on our side.

435.speaker: Karlach
435.text: Pity about Halsin. I was getting used to having an extra Strong around. He smelled nice, too. Like outside.
435.context: NodeContext: Karlach calls people on the strong rig body type (like herself) Strongs.

440.speaker: Karlach
440.text: Wow, so that was Mystra. Pretty spectacular stuff. But I think Gale was right not to agree to do her bidding, no questions asked.

366.speaker: Karlach
366.text: Proud of Gale, though. It takes some man to hold his own in front of the divine.

441.speaker: Karlach
441.text: And? Is it everything you hoped it would be?
441.context: NodeContext: Astarion chose to become a vampire lord. This is an 'evil path' for Astarion, so Karlach is a bit skeptical of this choice.

547.speaker: Player
547.text: I think it is. I am finally free. I am finally more powerful than Cazador. It was the only way.

391.speaker: Karlach
391.text: Maybe. Maybe not. But it is what it is. I'll stand by you until our mission is done - but I may not stick around long enough to see what you do with all this new power.
391.context: NodeContext: 'power' in parentheticals. Bitterness in her voice

220.speaker: Karlach
220.text: Wield your new power well. I have a real thing for stopping evil in its tracks these days. And unlike you, I'm not afraid to die.
220.context: NodeContext: A threat. Avatar Astarion has gone the evil route, but

445.speaker: Player
445.text: It will be, if you kneel before me.

207.speaker: Karlach
207.text: Don't push your luck, Astarion. Killing vampires - even ones as powerful as you - isn't that hard, you know.
207.context: NodeContext: Astarion told her to kneel (he is in pure hubris mode) and Karlach is having absolutely none of it.

389.speaker: Player
389.text: You will wait to speak until you are spoken to.

444.speaker: Karlach
444.text: You'll hate this, but... I'm so fucking proud of you.

381.speaker: Karlach
381.text: You could've had it all - but it would've cost you your soul. You kept what was worth keeping. That can't have been easy.

154.speaker: Karlach
154.text: No promises. You deserve to be told and told again what an incredible person you are.

415.speaker: Player
415.text: It wasn't. And I'm not sure I made the right choice.

249.speaker: Karlach
249.text: Give it time. Soon you'll start to see yourself how I see you: A man of integrity. Honour. And other words you absolutely detest.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Honestly, it was all right. I've changed so much, thanks in part to you.

570.speaker: Karlach
570.text: You've done the same for me. Who would've thought a vampire and a hellspawn could go so far together?

446.speaker: Karlach
446.text: She comes in here, into our camp, and lays hands on my Minthara?! Oh-ho, this shapeshifter is spoiling for a thrashing.

487.speaker: Player
487.text: That was Elminster Aumar - the most famous wizard in the realms.

28.speaker: Karlach
28.text: Huh. Doesn't ring a bell. But all right! Must've had something important to say to Gale, if he came all this way. Good news, I hope.

292.speaker: Player
292.text: I don't think it was. It turns out Gale has an explosive bomb in his chest - and Mystra has asked him to use it to blow up the heart of the Absolute.

190.speaker: Karlach
190.text: Whoa, now. He's got a... well, I guess that would explain a little, but... Mystra... I mean, this is a lot to take in.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I think he's going to follow through with it.

524.speaker: Karlach
524.text: Fuck me. There's devotion, and then there's stupidity. If the god of magic can't handle this without sacrificing Gale, she's no god at all.

574.speaker: Player
574.text: I don't think he'd do that to himself, even if Mystra commanded it.

342.speaker: Karlach
342.text: Good. I'm one hundred percent sure there's another way to bring down this cult. No true god would ask such a thing from her faithful. That's for certain.

177.speaker: Karlach
177.text: Poor Gale. He must be in bits after hearing that. I'll distract him. Tell him I haven't read a book since secondary school, watch his face melt off.

408.speaker: Player
408.text: I'm not sure. I think he's of several minds.

314.speaker: Karlach
314.text: Well, tell him to pick the right one. Better yet, I'll do it. Fucking wizards, man! They always need help picking the simple, obvious option.

492.speaker: Karlach
492.text: If Mystra can't think of another way to stop the Absolute than sacrificing Gale, she's no god worth worshipping. I'll say that to Gale - in, you know, gentle terms.

246.speaker: Player
246.text: You know that bomb in Gale's chest? Mystra has asked him to use it to explode the heart of the Absolute.

404.speaker: Karlach
404.text: Karlach doesn't worry, she acts. So if Gale needs me, now's the time to tell me.

126.speaker: Karlach
126.text: Wonder if he's a wizard too. He's certainly got the beardliness for it.

84.speaker: Karlach
84.text: Why'd he come all this way to track us down?

449.speaker: Karlach
449.text: Well. We stood by Astarion and defeated the last obstacle to his reign as the vampire lord of Baldur's Gate.

183.speaker: Karlach
183.text: Sometimes I really question my own decision-making.

450.speaker: Karlach
450.text: Just when I think I can't respect Jaheira any more. She's got a backup plan for if we fuck things up. Smart.

525.speaker: Karlach
525.text: Let's hope she doesn't need to use it. Not everyone wants to live forever.

460.speaker: Karlach
460.text: That contraption's a hot ticket item. Might not be our last scrap for its sake.

462.speaker: Karlach
462.text: We're in the belly of the beast now. Try not to do anything too heroic.

468.speaker: Karlach
468.text: Lae'zel, you know I admire that faithful heart of yours. But sometimes, being loyal to the wrong person can come back to bite you - hard. I hope this isn't one of those times.

471.speaker: Karlach
471.text: Shadowheart's really done it now. She's crossed a line she can never un-cross.

472.speaker: Karlach
472.text: Feels like we're walking into a trap.

478.speaker: Karlach
478.context: NodeContext: Warmth and delight for the player, with gravitas cause it was a tough old road

127.speaker: Karlach
127.text: This merits a celebration. You did what you had to do to get yourself right - to choose the life you wanted to live.

461.speaker: Karlach
461.text: Very fuckin proud of you, mate. Seriously.

76.speaker: Karlach
76.text: Very fuckin proud of you, darling. Seriously.

482.speaker: Karlach
482.text: Another visit from the golden paladin. It said we'll get the answers we need about the tadpole if we infiltrate the cult.

474.speaker: Player
474.text: We need to infiltrate Moonrise Towers, don't we? Exploring the tadpole's potential might make that easier.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: We'll need to be discreet to get in the heart of the cult. These powers might help.

602.speaker: Karlach
602.text: It's a fair point. I just don't want to take a short-term boon. I want to win this whole thing. To finish off the cult. To get this tadpole out. To stay sane the whole time.

600.speaker: Karlach
600.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

582.speaker: Player
582.text: I'm not sure  - if we can use these tadpoles for good before extracting them, it could be worth it.

591.speaker: Karlach
591.text: Could be. But I'm not sure either. And I'd rather rely on our wits and our weapons than a tadpole that could be up to anything in there.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: This feels like a trap. I don't think we should indulge this 'dream visitor' at all.

143.speaker: Karlach
143.text: Agreed. A bit of shiny armour doesn't impress me that much. I don't want to get taken in by a pretty offer and pay the price later on.

486.speaker: Karlach
486.text: That guy's a walking wound. He thinks Dame Aylin will fix whatever's broken in him. And he'll good as kill her to do it.
486.context: NodeContext: This is after she's killed Gortash and realized she doesn't feel any better after. She sees Lorroakan, who's like Gortash in many ways, with pity and repulsion, but without anger.

344.speaker: Karlach
344.text: I say we don't let Aylin anywhere near this guy. It won't do either of them any good.

327.speaker: Player
327.text: Lorroakan won't stop coming after her. We need to stop him - permanently.

526.speaker: Karlach
526.text: She can handle whatever that prick throws at her. Eventually he'll get bored. Maybe even move on to something more productive.

259.speaker: Player
259.text: Maybe. Maybe not. It's for Dame Aylin to decide.

466.speaker: Karlach
466.text: Fair enough. I only wish she'd have a bit of peace, after all the shit she's been through.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I think so. A man like Lorroakan doesn't simply lose interest in immortality.

186.speaker: Karlach
186.text: You know, I'm getting really tired of big-headed fools and their godsdamned schemes. Don't they ever go on holiday?

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: But fair enough. It's Dame Aylin's decision how she wants to deal with Lorroakan. I just wish she'd have a bit of peace after all she's been through.

512.speaker: Player
512.text: No. Most people want it all, until they have to work to get it.

396.speaker: Karlach
396.text: My thinking exactly. This weasel's got nothing on our demi-god. Nothing at all.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: We'll let Aylin deal with him in her own way.

49.speaker: Karlach
49.text: I guess that's her right. I've no doubt she can handle him. I just... well, there's a darkness in her. A pain I recognise.

328.speaker: Karlach
328.text: For now, she's bigger than it is. But things grow when you feed 'em. That's all.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Agreed. It's a risk we don't need to take.

81.speaker: Karlach
81.text: Exactly. And anyway, he'll see this is a losing gambit eventually. Maybe take up something more interesting, like darts.

494.speaker: Karlach
494.text: Gods. You've really done it now, haven't you.
494.context: NodeContext: In slight wonder. The Avatar really is as crazy as she feared (chosen of Bhaal)

592.speaker: Karlach
592.text: I need you to finish what we started. I need you to remember me - our mission - long enough for that. If you try anything else, I'll kill you. Understand?

495.speaker: Karlach
495.text: It's done. Shadowheart's gone. We did the right thing - right?

237.speaker: Player
237.text: She was a Sharran first and foremost. It was up to her cloister to decide her fate.

537.speaker: Karlach
537.text: I guess so. I guess it all makes sense. But it doesn't feel right.

538.speaker: Player
538.text: I'm not sure. Who knows what Viconia has in mind for her...

578.speaker: Karlach
578.text: That's what I can't get out of my head. Whatever she is, whatever she's done, she deserves... I don't know. Not to be tormented by zealots.

287.speaker: Player
287.text: I can't speak to right and wrong - but it's finished now. We shouldn't dwell on it.

534.speaker: Karlach
534.text: Whether we should or shouldn't, I'm gonna. Shadowheart was my friend. Or at least, I wanted her to be. I liked that little ball of points.

337.speaker: Player
337.text: In torture she will be free, she will remember only pain. Isn't that beautiful?

399.speaker: Karlach
399.text: That doesn't make me feel better. In fact, it makes me want to vomit.

498.speaker: Karlach
498.text: Wish I could say I was surprised about Cazador's pact. Where blood, death, and betrayal parade, you can bet your arse a devil is riding grand marshal.

499.speaker: Karlach
499.text: Raphael must be raging we didn't take his deal. Luckily, his desperation made him careless.

311.speaker: Karlach
311.text: Did you hear what he said? The hammer's in his House of Hope. If we wanted, we could steal it right out from under his nose.

417.speaker: Karlach
417.text: Granted, it wouldn't be easy. Devils guard their treasure by especially lethal means.

394.speaker: Karlach
394.text: We would need to find a diabolist. One worth their salt should be able to get us into that devil's lair.
394.context: NodeContext: She's pretty pissed at the player and is doing them this favour despite their big mistake. Spitting out 'that devil' as a slgiht to Raphael

531.speaker: Karlach
531.text: One last trip to Avernus. At least it'd be for a good reason, right?
531.context: NodeContext: Considering the possibility. Hasn't decided whether to go or not.

566.speaker: Karlach
566.text: We'd need to talk to Helsik. She'd know how to get into that devil's lair, if she's worth her salt.
566.context: NodeContext: She's pretty pissed at the player and is doing them this favour despite their big mistake. Spitting out 'that devil' as a slgiht to Raphael

307.speaker: Player
307.text: Do we even need the hammer?

262.speaker: Karlach
262.text: Maybe not. I wouldn't exactly relish heading into a devil's lair looking for it. But if you think it'll help us stop the Netherbain, I'll do anything.
262.context: NodeContext: A bit of a bitter retort.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: I don't like facing Raphael here in the city. I'm sure as hell not heading into his lair.

86.speaker: Karlach
86.text: Believe me, I don't relish the thought either. But we need to assess all our options. What matters most is defeating the brain and saving the city.
86.context: NodeContext: Harsh, but she's acting in the player's favour here. She's not accepting their ruling that their deal with Raphael is final.

5.speaker: Karlach
5.text: If we can do that without heisting in the Hells, believe me, I'm all for it.

243.speaker: Player
243.text: How would we even get in?

502.speaker: Karlach
502.text: You killed Isobel. And all those people besides. What's wrong with you?!

193.speaker: Player
193.text: I don't know. I'm out of control. Help me.

130.speaker: Karlach
130.text: I want to, but I don't know how. And I'm starting to wonder if there's anything I can do. Or anything you can do.
130.context: NodeContext: Fear, anger, sadness, all mixed together. Her friend is really losing the plot.

225.speaker: Karlach
225.text: You have to stay strong. You have to resist. If you don't, we're all doomed.
225.context: NodeContext: Fear, anger, sadness, all mixed together. Her friend is really losing the plot.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: The cleric is gone. The shadows have devoured the innocent. Oh, glorious night!

136.speaker: Karlach
136.context: NodeContext: Fear, anger, sadness, all mixed together. Her friend is really losing the plot.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: My actions do not concern you. Leave me.

94.speaker: Karlach
94.text: Be careful what you wish for.
94.context: NodeContext: Venomous. Threatening to leave the party.

506.speaker: Karlach
506.text: Hey, Shads. I know you've just heard a lot of pretty shocking stuff. I can't pretend to know how you're feeling, but I want you to know I'm beside you.
506.context: NodeContext: Her being affectionate toward Shadowheart (regardless of romance) during SH's time of need.

507.speaker: Karlach
507.text: I dare Cazador to send more lackeys our way. This is our territory. I'll crack anyone who tries to come into my house and hurt my people.

508.speaker: Karlach
508.text: This place is done for. Let's get out of here.
508.context: NodeContext: Not too urgent but not hanging around.

516.speaker: Karlach
516.text: Shapeshifters in the Harpers. My dad always admired their mission - said they gave up their entire lives so we could live safely, and asked for nothing in return. We'll rout them, right? For the city - and for dad.

517.speaker: Karlach
517.text: I recognise some of these people. They had the grit to get out of one hell, only to stumble into another.

411.speaker: Karlach
411.text: Some people have all the luck.
411.context: NodeContext: gallows humor, talking about how the tieflings got out of hell only to get stuck in another hell.

518.speaker: Karlach
518.text: Kith'rak Voss didn't know who he was dealing with, did he? Throw salt on Vlaakith's name in front of Lae'zel of Crèche K'liir, and you're gonna get a hard spanking.

66.speaker: Karlach
66.text: Your queen ought to be proud of you.

521.speaker: Karlach
521.text: Lae'zel. Vlaakith spoke your name. She knows exactly who you are.
521.context: NodeContext: Her friend Lae'zel just got acknowledged by her queen. This is the peak of Lae'zel's life up to this point. Karlach is so happy for her. But it's a serious moment, so should have a good bit of gravitas.

206.speaker: Karlach
206.text: Do what you came here to do. I've got your back.

523.speaker: Karlach
523.text: Minsc is working for the cult? Damn. He must've been tadpoled - or worse. The real Minsc would never join up with the godsdamned Absolute.

429.speaker: Karlach
429.text: Maybe we can help him - the Prism, right? It should shut that tadpole up - if he doesn't kick our butts first. It's kind of his thing.
429.context: NodeContext: 'kicking butt' is a famous Minsc line

527.speaker: Karlach
527.text: Ketheric's waiting for us. Can only imagine the beating that angel is preparing for him.

214.speaker: Karlach
214.text: Thanks to Shadowheart's good sense, we've got a chance at beating him.

529.speaker: Karlach
529.text: Fucking shapeshifter. She'll try to break our best asset: Our trust. Fortunately she's no match for our second-best asset: me.

532.speaker: Karlach
532.text: I kinda like that mouldy water smell.

533.speaker: Karlach
533.text: Hm? Did you... are you talking to me?
533.context: NodeContext: In the Sharran cloister, devoted to the goddess of loss and forgetting. Karlach is ok, but she's susceptible to the environment.

535.speaker: Karlach
535.text: She thinks she can take my druid and live to tell the tale? Dream on, shapeshifter. Karlach's coming for you.

540.speaker: Karlach
540.text: The Blade of Frontiers. That's the Wyll we know and love, isn't it? Gods, that man really is the best.

542.speaker: Karlach
542.text: Gods, Shadowheart looks like a stack of gold! Never thought I could get so excited about someone's forehead, but here we are.

546.speaker: Karlach
546.text: Well done getting the wizard on board. He can zap from afar while I smack up close. But if he tries to get me to read any tomes, I will scream.
546.context: NodeContext: Context, Karlach does not like to read.

548.speaker: Karlach
548.text: Can you feel it? This is the Lord of Murder's domain. If we can survive this, we'll have really stuck it to him.

552.speaker: Karlach
552.text: Lae'zel. Vlaakith spoke your name. She knows exactly who you are. And you stood up to her.
552.context: NodeContext: Her friend Lae'zel just got acknowledged by her queen. This is the peak of Lae'zel's life up to this point. Karlach is so happy for her. But it's a serious moment, so should have a good bit of gravitas.

553.speaker: Karlach
553.text: Shadowheart looks so happy, doesn't she? She seems... found. In a way she never seemed before, even when she was most devoted to Shar.

173.speaker: Karlach
173.text: Her folks must be so glad to have her back. And to see who she's become.

556.speaker: Karlach
556.text: I like Gale, but I'm keeping all my good gear well out of sight.

355.speaker: Karlach
355.text: Everything fancy he touches meets a grisly end.

425.speaker: Karlach
425.text: I commiserate with his situation, though. It's tough ticks housing something you can't control.

557.speaker: Karlach
557.text: Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard. Has a ring to it, doesn't it? It sounds like... like a fate you earned.

72.speaker: Karlach
72.text: I can't think of a better caretaker for the city I love. You're going to do so much for Baldur's Gate, Wyll.

571.speaker: Karlach
571.text: Goblin parties are so much more fun than anything you'll find in Baldur's Gate. Or the Hells, for that matter.

24.speaker: Karlach
24.text: Not that I'm suggesting we stop for a drink, of course.
24.context: NodeContext: She's definitely suggesting this, but is trying to be coy about it.

573.speaker: Karlach
573.text: I'm speechless. A Bhaalist among us like this. If we didn't need the fucker, I'd say we run for the hills.
573.context: NodeContext: In slight wonder. The Avatar really is as crazy as she feared (chosen of Bhaal)

576.speaker: Karlach
576.text: Dame Aylin has unleashed on this place. Ketheric will be waiting for us on the rooftop. Let's help her finish the job.

577.speaker: Karlach
577.text: Oh, Shadowheart. You may not remember what you've done. But I do.
577.context: NodeContext: Deep disappointment, almost to the point of heartbreak, that SH went the evil route.

580.speaker: Karlach
580.text: Whoa. I've seen a lot, but never been threatened by a god.

318.speaker: Karlach
318.text: It sounded like you really meant it. You really want to take control of the Karsite Weave.

323.speaker: Karlach
323.text: You really want to be a god.
323.context: NodeContext: She's not bought in. She's assessing GAle here. Measuring him.

497.speaker: Karlach
497.text: Interesting. I'll keep that in mind.
497.context: NodeContext: She's starting to lack trust in Gale here,

581.speaker: Karlach
581.text: Shadowheart versus Lae'zel. I can't believe ol' mysteria defeated a githyanki warrior.
581.context: NodeContext: Tonally somewhat grave: Lae'zel is dead.

596.speaker: Karlach
596.text: I've underestimated her. Won't make that mistake again.
596.context: NodeContext: Tonally somewhat grave: Lae'zel is dead.

584.speaker: Karlach
584.text: I made it back. I'm here. Thank the gods, thank the gods.
584.context: NodeContext: She's delighted to be back home after 10 years away. Taking in the sights and sounds, the vibes. This is a little internal, talking to herself a bit even theough the player is there.

587.speaker: Karlach
587.text: Wish I could say I was surprised about Cazador's pact. Where blood, death, and betrayal parade, you can bet your arse a devil is riding grand marshal.

275.speaker: Karlach
275.text: We're going to keep Astarion safe. On my life, Cazador won't touch him.

588.speaker: Karlach
588.text: Wonder if Jaheira ever hangs around the Outer City. Maybe after this is over, I could buy her a drink. Does she drink? She likes wine. Wine then. This is all happening so fast!
588.context: NodeContext: Karlach being awkward about her fangirling over Jaheira.

589.speaker: Karlach
589.text: We've got this. We're nearly there.

594.speaker: Karlach
594.text: Soldier, this is it! We're almost to the city. First through Wyrm's Crossing, then on to the Lower City.
594.context: NodeContext: She hasn't been home in 10 years so she's very excited

106.speaker: Karlach
106.text: Ah, it smells the exact same. Ten years on, but still home. Incredible.
106.context: NodeContext: Maybe a little verklempt here, but only just

595.speaker: Karlach
595.text: Tsk. I was afraid of this.
595.context: NodeContext: Karlach reflection AFTER defeating Gortash, then seeing Nightsong go after Lorroakan, and expressing worry that revenge would not help Nightsong heal from what happened to her.

484.speaker: Karlach
484.text: Revenge sounds so sweet until you've taken it. Then all you have is... no one left to blame.
484.context: NodeContext: Karlach reflection AFTER defeating Gortash, then seeing Nightsong go after Lorroakan, and expressing worry that revenge would not help Nightsong heal from what happened to her.

519.speaker: Player
519.text: Dame Aylin has endured a great deal; she must be tired of killing evil-doers.

597.speaker: Karlach
597.text: She's more than tired. Something's happening inside her. And who could blame her, after what she's endured.

455.speaker: Karlach
455.text: I just hope Aylin's as wise enough to sort it out before it sorts her.

209.speaker: Player
209.text: Something tells me Dame Aylin will find someone else to blame. And then another.

476.speaker: Karlach
476.text: Gods help whoever she trains her sword on next. But I hope it stays sheathed for a while yet. For her sake.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Are you talking about Dame Aylin or yourself?

241.speaker: Karlach
241.text: Us strongs understand each other. Especially in the empty minutes after a fight you didn't ask for. Or maybe shouldn't have.
241.context: NodeContext: Kind of a funny line, but she's not really laughing or joking around. Karalch gallows humour tone. Minsc/Haslin (the other strong rig characters will chime in after this)

375.speaker: Minsc
375.text: This is why Boo never allows such silence to fall. Prick your ears, and there is always another buttock crying out for a kick.
375.context: NodeContext: Thinks he's providing sound mental health advice.

395.speaker: Halsin
395.text: There is a particular discomfort to besting one you know to be weaker than yourself - even when needs must.

604.speaker: Karlach
604.text: How long do you think we're going to last with a wildcard like that in the party?

605.speaker: Karlach
605.text: You know, for a while there, I wasn't sure you'd come back from Sharville. But look at you. You've done what few could ever do - created your own path.

162.speaker: Karlach
162.text: Your folks must be so very, very proud of you.
